result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Stetter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

Defendant shall take medications as prescribed.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Stetter

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Resolution reached.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Letter from Judicial Assistant for Branch 3 to Dep Dist Atty Stephanie Hanson
State's Discovery Demand
Letter received from Atty Hanson

Jury status hearing at 11-16-2015 09:45 am.
Jury trial at 12-07-2015 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Not guilty plea entered.  One day jury trial set.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing at 09-16-2015 09:45 am

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Pretrial offer pending.  Counsel requests adjournment to receive and review records.  If no resolution, matter will be set for trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Hearing at 08-19-2015 08:15 am
Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Counsels first appearance, needs time for discovery and pretrial. Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery & Inspection
Letter received from Atty Kenitz
Hearing at 07-27-2015 09:45 am
Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order.
Hearing at 07-27-2015 09:45 am

Def appeared in person.  Intern Samuel Tufford with Atty. Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Court appoints Atty. Michael Kentiz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 9-01-15.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with Atty. Kenitz.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Hearing at 07-01-2015 02:45 pm
Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing at 06-03-2015 02:45 pm

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Def waives right to attorney.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel and accepts waiver.  Adjourned to allow pretrial.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No possession of firearms; Maintain absolute sobriety
Hearing on May 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $1000.00 sig bond.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
